summary: The Invest to Protect Act of 2025 establishes a grant program within the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services to provide assistance to local law enforcement agencies. The grants will fund de-escalation training, mental health resources and access, recruitment and retention bonuses for officers, and evidence-based training in areas like active shooter situations and handling calls involving individuals with mental health needs, substance use disorders, and other vulnerable populations. The bill outlines application processes, reporting requirements, and accountability measures, including audits and preventing duplicative grants, and authorizes $50 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030.
